author: M3 Web - http://m3web.bg
title: Tragic Accident in Northwestern Turkey Claims Lives and Injures Dozens
text:
Tragic Accident in Northwestern Turkey Claims Lives and Injures Dozens
[World](articles/category/30/World)» [SOUTHEAST EUROPE](articles/category/151/Southeast+Europe)| December 28, 2023, Thursday // 11:02
A devastating chain accident in the northwestern Turkish province of Sakarya resulted in a tragic toll this morning. According to reports from the Anatolian Agency, ten individuals lost their lives, while over 50 sustained injuries in the incident on the Northern Marmara highway toward Istanbul. The collision involved seven vehicles, including buses and a truck, with the reasons behind the accident still under investigation.
Reports from Turkish broadcaster NTV, cited by Reuters, indicated that thick fog and poor visibility were prevalent during the crash. Responders from various agencies, including the gendarmerie, firefighters, medical teams, and the Disaster and Emergency Management Directorate (AFAD), immediately rushed to the scene.
Governor Yashar Karadeniz confirmed preliminary casualties, citing 10 fatalities and 57 injuries, with some in critical condition. The governor mentioned that the chain reaction began after a car collided with a truck. Shockingly, some victims lost their lives after exiting their vehicles on the highway and being struck by passing cars.
Meanwhile, Health Minister Fahrettin Koca shared on social media that 59 individuals were injured, with eight in critical condition. Efforts to clear the accident site and recover the vehicles involved are ongoing, resulting in the temporary halt of traffic towards Istanbul.
The Sakarya County Prosecutor's Office has initiated an investigation into the incident. Justice Minister Yilmaz Tunc confirmed the appointment of three prosecutors to lead the investigation, with six drivers already detained. Additionally, an injured driver, currently receiving medical treatment, will face custody upon recovery.

author: Kaya Martin
title: Rapper and actor Ice Cube announces two-date Australian tour this March
text:
West Coast rap legend Ice Cube is bringing his no-holds-barred brand of hip hop down under, announcing a pair of headline shows. Words by Staff Writer
West Coast rap legend Ice Cube is bringing his no-holds-barred brand of hip hop down under, announcing a pair of headline shows that'll shake Sidney Myer Music Bowl and Sydney's ICC Theatre this March.
The NWA co-founder turned solo powerhouse will kick things off at ICC Theatre on March 7, before rolling through Melbourne's iconic outdoor amphitheatre on March 9. These shows mark Ice Cube's first Australian appearances since his 2018 tour supporting his politically-charged record Everythang's Corrupt.
Ice Cube 2025 Australia Tour
Mar 7 – ICC Theatre, Sydney
Mar 8 – Sidney Myer Music Bowl, Melbourne
Tickets go on sale on Friday,…
Kaya Martin

author: TyC Sports.com
title: La confesión de un histórico de Bayern Múnich sobre Boca: "Sería increíble..." - TyC Sports
text:
Thomas Müller confesó que "sería increíble" jugar contra Boca y elogió al Superclásico
El histórico delantero de Bayern Múnich palpitó el cruce que se viene en el Grupo C del Mundial de Clubes y catalogó como "muy especiales" los enfrentamientos con River.
A sus 35 años, Thomas Müller se ganó un nombre en el diccionario del fútbol internacional. Fue campeón del mundo con la selección de Alemania en Brasil 2014 y ganó múltiples títulos (32) con Bayern Múnich, el único club de su carrera. Pero todavía hay ciertas experiencias que le siguen generando expectativa. Este es el caso del partido ante Boca en el Mundial de Clubes, en el que compartirá el Grupo C.
“Sería increíble jugar contra ellos. Como aficionado sé mucho del fútbol argentino por la TV, Internet y las redes sociales", comenzó uno de los capitanes del elenco bávaro, en una entrevista con el sitio web oficial de la FIFA.
No conforme con eso, el delantero recordó su amistad con Martín Demichelis, quien fue entrenador de River entre 2023 y 2024 y jugó junto a él en Bayern durante dos años, y le dedicó palabras elogiosas al partido más importante del campeonato nacional: "Mi ex compañero Micho fue DT y cuando juegan contra Boca es una locura. Cuando se enfrentan esos equipos tradicionales, es algo muy especial”.
El sorteo realizado en diciembre del año pasado determinó que el Xeneize integrará el Grupo C con el )equipo alemán, Benfica de Portugal y Auckland City de Nueva Zelanda). Por su parte, el Millonario cayó en el E y enfrentará a Inter de Italia, Monterrey de México y Urawa Red Diamonds de Japón.
Más allá de la complejidad que presenta la zona, Edinson Cavani, referente del cuadro de la Ribera, no se achicó cuando fue consultado sobre el objetivo pro la página oficial de FIFA. "Boca es un club inmenso, en el que cada vez que se enfrenta a un torneo o a la competición que tengamos por delante, siempre aspira a ganarlo. Vamos a ir a hacer un buen torneo para poder acercarnos a lo que pueda ser un logro histórico", soltó, y aseveró que contra los bávaros "es el partido más especial por la historia de ambos".
Las declaraciones de Cavani sobre el Mundial de Clubes

author: Robyn Pennacchia
title: Have We Had Enough Grocery Store Price Gouging Yet? Time For A Federal Ban?
text: Kamala Harris to announce plans for a federal ban on price-gouging. If there is one thing that most Americans can agree on, it is that almost everything that regular people have to buy or spend money on in order to survive has gotten way the hell too expensive. Groceries, rent … well, mostly groceries and rent. That is why, at Friday’s campaign stop in North Carolina, Vice President Kamala Harris is set to announce her plans to put an end to all of that, one of which will be a federal ban on price gouging. (Pause for terrified shrieks!) Harris also plans to address the problem of mergers between grocery stores and food producers “specifically for the risk that the proposed merger would raise grocery prices for consumers,” the campaign said in a statement. Because hey! If capitalists believe that competition keeps prices down, they should want to limit the ability of individual companies to monopolize any given market, right? Loving this post? Not a free or paid subscriber yet? Let’s fix that! Harris also plans to address the increasing costs of prescription drugs and housing, both of which are caused by greed and not any kind of necessity. Harris reportedly plans on singling out the meat industry, with the statement noting that “soaring meat prices have accounted for a large part of Americans’ higher grocery bills, even as meat processing companies registered record-breaking profits following the pandemic.” As a known enjoyer of chicken wings, I would very much appreciate this! How are we living in a world in which there are still dollar oyster nights everywhere but I’m seeing a dozen chicken wings for $26 at normal-ass bars? Legally, oysters are fancier than chicken wings and this just confuses everything. It would be one thing if we were paying more for things because of labor costs or even because of demand — as we were when the supply chains were snarled during the pandemic. But then companies got a taste for those higher prices leading to higher profits — and when the supply chains untangled themselves, prices stayed the same. As much as I hate to say this, we actually don’t pay as much for many things as we should and as much as we would pay if everyone throughout the supply chain were being paid fairly. Employers here want to keep wages down, which means that the people who make the things that we buy have to be paid even less, and in many cases, nothing. For instance, in the 1950s, when most clothing people wore was made here by unionized ILGU workers, the average cost of a middle class woman’s dress was about $30, which today would be about $390 (which is also why people would only have, like, five dresses total). That was fair. It also meant that the people who made those dresses were able to spend money themselves and contribute to the economy. But we’re not paying more so that everyone in the supply chain can make a living wage, we are literally paying extra so that CEOs and stockholders can get richer. We’ve literally heard them on sales calls bragging about the profits they’ve made from raising prices. These companies are charging more simply because they can get away with it. Because no one is telling them “No.” It’s time for them all to be told “No.” OPEN THREAD! PREVIOUSLY ON WONKETTE! ·

author: Eleanor Tolbert
title: My family say I'm a monster for not donating kidney to sister - Daily Express US
text: 'My family think I'm a monster for refusing to donate my kidney to my sister' A woman is in a difficult position after discovering she is her sister's only hope of survival - but she fears the impact donating a kidney could have on her. A woman faces a heart-wrenching dilemma that could spell disaster for either [her or her sister,](/lifestyle/life/145475/my-family-monster-not-donating-kidney-sister) and she's taken to [kidney](/latest/kidney-cancer) failure, and the doctors have made it clear that a transplant is essential for her survival. The [younger sibling](/lifestyle/parenting/144900/my-mom-pregnant-has-stolen-name-i-wanted-call-my-future-daughter?utm_source=mynewsassistant.com&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=embedded_search_item_mobile) is the only match in their family. Their [relationship has been rocky](#), with the ['I've been planning my baby's name since I was 12 — Then my brother stole it'](/lifestyle/parenting/144559/ive-been-planning-my-babys-name-since-i-was-12-my-brother-stole-it) [Pharmacy worker astonished as mom legally changes son's name to unique moniker](/lifestyle/life/144277/mom-legally-changes-baby-name) Complicating matters further, the 19-year-old has health concerns of her own, making the prospect of major surgery potentially harmful. Torn by her predicament, she shared: "When I found out I'm the only possible donor, I felt overwhelmed. I've tried talking to my family about my reservations, but they insist that it's my duty to save her because we're family." Her sister has expressed deep disappointment, suggesting that a refusal to donate would be proof of her lack of care: "My sister is understandably upset and has been telling me that if I don't donate, it proves I don't care about her." Amidst accusations from her family that withholding her kidney would make her a terrible person, the young woman is caught between not wanting her sister to die and protecting her own well-being. Follow Daily Express US on Google News Click [here](https://news.google.com/publications/CAAqBwgKMNDMhwsw4oHpAg?ceid=US%3Aen&oc=3) to follow [Daily Express US](/) on Google News to stay up to date with all the latest US, showbiz, and sports news. In the comments, individuals who have experienced kidney donation firsthand weighed in. One commenter offered advice, saying: "Tell the transplant team you are being coerced to donate. They will then tell your family you are ineligible to donate. They will not say why because of HIPAA if you're in the States. Most countries have similar rules." Another pointed out that health concerns might prevent her from being cleared to donate by a doctor. A different user highlighted additional considerations, noting that some research indicates increased risks for women who become pregnant after donating a kidney, even if they are in perfect health.

author: 互傳媒／記者 張學宜
title: 嘉義市長現身救災前線致謝 盧秀燕承諾：救援絕不缺席
text:
互傳媒 嘉義市長現身救災前線致謝 盧秀燕承諾：救援絕不缺席 閱讀全文
互傳媒／記者 張學宜 2025年7月10日 上午10:20 【互傳媒／記者 張學宜／台中 報導】中颱丹娜絲重創嘉義，台中市政府建設局救災團隊持續支援災後重建；嘉義市長黃敏惠昨（10）日下午特地前往救災現場，向台中市建設團隊表達誠摯感謝，並高度肯定台中團隊不畏風雨、專業有力的支援行動。黃敏惠表示，真的非常感謝盧秀燕市長的協助，尤其建設局團隊出動大型機具及專業救災團隊，非常給力！
建設局長陳大田表示，嘉義市長黃敏惠昨（9）日深夜親自致電盧市長，除了代表嘉義市民表達深深謝意，並懇請台中市能持續協助救災，盧市長在電話中立即回應「絕對沒有問題！」展現兩市同心協力、共度難關的情誼，也體現「同島一命、同舟共濟」的精神。
陳大田進一步說明，現場救災行動由副總工程司郭坤雄帶隊，團隊頂著風雨持續清除倒塌路樹、搬運廢枝葉至暫置場。經統計，目前世賢路一段（忠孝路至文化路口）已完成全面清理作業，另自由路至北港路口路段也完成約八成進度，市府建設團隊將持續強化重機具支援，全力加速復原作業，盼早日恢復嘉義市整潔市容。
建設局指出，此次救援出動鏟裝機(山貓)7台、吊卡車8台、抓斗車3台、傾斜式卡車9台、挖土機1台、鏈鋸32台；截至第3日，救災人員總出勤人次已達137人次，並視天候變化機動調整作業，落實「安全第一、效率並重」原則，持續陪伴嘉義市度過難關、早日恢復市容。
